title: Brighton offered £3m for Beram Kayal by same Chinese Super League club who wanted Diego Costa
text:
Pay for Kay Brighton offered £3m for Beram Kayal by same Chinese Super League club who wanted Diego Costa 
Tianjin Quanjian want to sign Israeli international and Brighton will consider bid before their transfer window shuts Exclusive   BRIGHTON midfielder Beram Kayal has been targeted by the same Chinese Super League team that wanted Diego Costa. 
Tianjin Quanjian, who attempted to land Chelsea striker Costa , have slapped in a £3million bid for the Israel international. Reuters 4 Beram Kayal is wanted by the same Chinese Super League team who were after Diego Costa 
The offer threatens to disrupt Chris Hughton’s promotion campaign as he attempts to finish in the Championship top two. 
Brighton will consider the offer, which would see Kayal head out to the Far East before their window shuts at the end of the month. 
Kayal, 28, has been at the Amex for three years but a move to China could see him land a bumper contract. Getty Images The Brighton midfielder could have his head turned by a lucrative move to the Far East Reuters Chelsea striker Diego Costa was a target of Tianjin Quanjian Reuters 4 Chris Hughton’s promotion charge may hit a snag if Beram Kayal departs 
Meanwhile, Seagulls defender Connor Goldson will not play again this season after the club identified a potential heart problem. 
The 24-year-old has been withdrawn from action and will have an operation after routine screening identified “a possible risk factor”. 
Hughton said: “This is a significant blow for Connor and also the club. Brighton signed Goldson from Shrewsbury in 2015 and he has made 37 first-team appearances. 
Former Bolton midfielder Fabrice Muamba was forced to retire from football after suffering a cardiac arrest on the pitch in an FA Cup tie against Tottenham in March 2012.
